website_summaries.verdict: A fine, floating pellet for small goldfish, which includes the essential vitamins, minerals, and supplements younger fish need to grow up healthy.
pros: Made with marine fish meal and fish oil
Less waste, so water stays clearer
cons: Soybean meal, wheat middlings, wheat flour, and corn gluten are the first 4 ingredients

customer_reviews.title: BIG dize
customer_reviews.text: Pellets are pretty big - 5-7 mm in length (see photo: from left to right: Hikari micro wafers, New Life 1mm pellets, Wardley shrimp pellets). Even my 5" clown loch can't fit them whole in his mouth. Broken off pieces instantly dissolve into mush and pollute the water. I wish they made them smaller! My loch and Angel fish really like them!
customer_reviews.author: N. Neymark

customer_reviews.title: A big difference for my fish
customer_reviews.text: For the first 18+ months, I fed my fish the orange-red pellets from a major brand name pet store. My betta was blue and iridescent white when I bought him, but his white parts turned orange-red shortly after I got him home. I decided at last to try there Wardley ones, which are just plain brown and do not appear to have dye in them. My fish's lovely iridescent color is almost completely back, after less than 3 weeks on the new diet! I am really delighted. He also seems to have more energy.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Bottom Feeders
customer_reviews.text: This is my all time favorite food to put in my aquarium. My cory cats, snails and plecos love these. Not only that, my fish come down and feast on these as well because they love them. They are small little pellets but what I like most about these is that once they sit in the water and soak up the water, as the fish eat them little particles go out from there and feed my smaller baby fish who are too timid to swim to the top of the tank for the fish flakes. These are perfect for fry in breeder boxes as well and I have raised many batches with these. I will never buy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Cat, Chris and Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Product
customer_reviews.text: As pictured on the left: The size I got at the store, and thought I was buying here. On the right: The size I bought here. Definitely WAY worth the price. This stuff will last forever, even with over 80 fish munching on it every 1-3 days. I am a huge fan of Wardley products. The shrimp pellets are the absolute FAVORITE of my cory cats and sucking loaches, and these flakes are also amazing. Almost not water waste, no bright dyes like other brands, and they make my fish so bright and happy. They adore these flakes and I suggest any wardley product if you're looking for a healthy, budget feed for your beloved swimmers.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Hargis

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, tiny flakes
customer_reviews.text: Maybe they changed the definition of "large flakes" when I wasn't paying attention. On opening the can there were some bigger flakes on top and I was encouraged. After the top 1/8 inch there was nothing but tiny, tiny pieces that my bigger fish can't seem to see. Most sink to the bottom of tank to crap it up. Evidently it is an industry wide practice to smash fish flakes as small as possible because another brand I previously used to like started packing very small flakes also. Too bad the label says "Original Large Flake Formula". I'll keep searching for a company that still produces large fish flakes.
customer_reviews.author: whtsituya

customer_reviews.title: A Staple for every Aquarist
customer_reviews.text: One of the best fish foods out there. I've been using these for forever. All fish I've ever had went for them, even though they sink. Top and mid range feeders will follow them to the bottom. :) My 15+ year old Striped Rafael was raised on and practically lives on them. They've come in handy for the occasional accidental batch of baby bristlenose plecos and kribensis dwarf cichlids. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Some Blue Devil

customer_reviews.title: Betta loves these
customer_reviews.text: When I first got my betta, he didn’t touch these at all for the first day. After he got over the transfer shock, he’s been gulping these down in 1 bite every time. Recently, I found out it’s better to soak these in tank water first before feeding. If you soak these first, they get 3 times the size and will help prevent constipation.
customer_reviews.author: Xing W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: The pellet food is horrible! It makes my goldfish tank water very cloudy and hazy! I had to change the water 3 times this week. Now, my goldfish are dying. They are semi-floating in the tank. I'm going to see if I can return this product. Update: All my goldfish died within 5 days within feeding the wardley pellet food.
customer_reviews.author: Almo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this CR*P - it's horrible dust like artificial coloring junk.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE - NEW FORMULA IS FOULING MY WHOLE TANK - APPLY FOR A REFUND IMMEDIATELY IF YOUR PACKING LOOKS DIFFERNT THAT THAN THIS PICTURE - New formula is TERRIBLE!!! Item received is not what the picture shows, new packaging, new product completely. Flakes are neon-tetra sized (less than 1/10 the previous size) instead of what is pictured here, this old packaging contained flakes that were big enough for my chiclids - and they really liked the old formula; they won't touch this new crud (more profound explitive deserved).
customer_reviews.author: bpbudeman

customer_reviews.title: a big hit with my fishies
customer_reviews.text: My fish fight over these - bala sharks, pleco, and clown loach - though they are really to feed my pictish catfish. I have to make sure I put in enough so there is some left for them! The pellets drop fast and don't cloud the water. They seem to prefer this brand over other similar products I've given. My only complaint is I always tear the plastic lid a bit in opening repeatedly over time. No big deal since they eat them fairly fast I don't think they have a chance to get stale.
customer_reviews.author: J & D Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Fish and dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: My bottom feeders love these shrimp pellets. They are firm and crispy. And my dogs love them also. I don't have cats so I can't tell you but I would think they would also like them. I feed the dogs a couple of pellets when I feed the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Zenjon

customer_reviews.title: Fish say it's good
customer_reviews.text: From the very first drop into the tank, it was clear that this was a good purchase. It's supposed to be for cories but all fish went after it as it's the best stuff they ever tasted. Even fish that are way too small to actually eat it. They tried anyway. And for their luck, the pellets disintegrate in the water very fast and thus, even smaller fish can easily get their share by nibbling on it. It's also very much liked by my Neocaridina shrimps.
customer_reviews.author: flymaster

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our beta had stopped eating and was not acting right. She would just kinda float around and look depressed or sad. She was loosing color and never responded to our prompting of food pit in the tank. After only 2 days of the new food she was back to actually swimming and looking happy. Using the plants and other items as toys again. Hiding and zig zagging and following our fingers again. Her color is bright again and is a truer blue as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: New Formula Stinks!
customer_reviews.text: Agree with previous user. The "new" formula stinks! No, really it smells BAD. The original formula had a very light smell, was large flaked and was drab green in color. The latest product is small flaked, brightly colored and smells like rotting fish. The result; the fish tank is starting to smell too. VERY unhappy with this NEW product!!! Bring back the Original Recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K

customer_reviews.title: Very good product, to say the least!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about two weeks ago.. And bought more.. All my fish, including my cichlids, pleco, blue lobster, and my squeaker catfish, along with danio's, and my jack dempsey, will eat these like crazy.. It's actually crazy watching everyone, fight over this stuff... Lol.. Good quality pellet... I can't even say anything else.. Extremely happy with this product.. 😊👍😉 Hope you have as much great luck, as I have...
customer_reviews.author: HK Kustoms

customer_reviews.title: Too Large For Most Betta Fish
customer_reviews.text: As the other reviews state, these pieces are very large. My beta can’t eat them. He tried a few times and gave up. Now he just sits and waits for the other food to show up. I figured they would make good snail food but they won’t sink. They just float at the top and get moldy. If your fish is large these will probably work well. For most bettas I would recommend something smaller (like Aqueon Betta Food).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: Gold Fish love it and seems more healthy
customer_reviews.text: Gotbmedium pellets. First day or two looked like fish didn't want to eat it (after getting used to dry blood worms). But on 3rd day fish started eating and going crazy after this food. Fish became much more lively. Swimming around in fast maneuvers. Overall looks more happy and healthy. Previously, fish was kind of depressed and usually not moving a lot and sitting in a corner. Probably had stomach issues. Now completely different fish!
customer_reviews.author: Customer1234

customer_reviews.title: Floating pellet formula clogs filter
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this fish food for my pet beta, I read good reviews and thought I would try these vs the flakes I normally use. First the pellets look tiny but were swell up huge after sitting in water for awhile. I had a real problem with the pellets getting stuck in the back of my fish's water filter. It was super gross and clogged the filter really bad. I requested a return and was immediately refunded which was nice. Maybe the floating pellets were designed for larger more mature betas or different fish. Hope you have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Steele

customer_reviews.title: My betta loves them
customer_reviews.text: My betta loves these pellets, he will literally beg for them all day. They are very small so they can easily be eaten even by small bettas. They will never sink unlike other pellets which is great because my betta sometimes has a hard time eating because he gets too excited. His color has also gotten a lot brighter and he has become more colorful since he has started eating these
customer_reviews.author: MKD

customer_reviews.title: Great for pond fish!
customer_reviews.text: We have some goldfish we keep outside in a pond during the summer, but due to weather and freezing we bring them inside during the wintertime. During the summer they eat anything that drops into the pond (mosquito eggs, worms, debris, etc.) so we don't feed them outside, but we exclusively use these Wardley goldfish pellets inside. The fish LOVE them, and do great during the wintertime. Their color remains vibrant, and they stay intact for quite a while in the water to give the fish time to eat. These pellets also do not cloud the water too much, which is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Massive size
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked super shocked at the size! All of the fish food I've ever bought has been in a small container this came in a massive container. My fish doesn't seem to mind. I would purchase again but I honestly don't think I'll ever have to.
customer_reviews.author: whatshotmama

customer_reviews.title: All my fish loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought throw for my corycats but all my platys are fighting this this corycats. I usually put some flakes for platys first but they just ignore the flakes and chase the sinking pellets. One big bully platys will push all corys away and takes the pellet to her corner to enjoy it alone. My corys have to swim to the surface to eat the flakes.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Betta refuses to eat this
customer_reviews.text: I tried these pellets with my betta for a couple of months, but he rarely ate them. I got worried he wasn’t eating enough and for him frozen shrimp which he gobbles up. I bought another brand of pellets and he LOVES those. I don’t know if it’s the flavor or size or what, but he won’t eat these.
customer_reviews.author: DeeL42

customer_reviews.title: This is huge
customer_reviews.text: I have fish and a small 1 oz bottle of this food is $3 at petco. Found this on amazon. The bottle is HUGE and I love the fact I paid < $3 for this big bottle. Very pleased as are my fish Edward, Bella, Esme, Carlisle, Jasper, Alice, Rosalie, Emmett, Renesme and Jacob. Will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Icy Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Can squished and almost all the food leaked out
customer_reviews.text: It came in an envelope and had fish food leaking out. When I opened it the can was squished and had came open. When I dumped the envelope out I don't even think I had a fourth of a cup of fish food in it. I also thought it was suppose to be flakes. It was powder like but that could of been due to it being squashed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great packaging, the fish love them and they SINK!
customer_reviews.text: Fish love these and they SINK! I previously bought the big, 1lb "bulk" type wafers - these were problematic because they get soft with high humidity and don't come in the best packaging and they sometimes float at the top and need a little push to head down. These Wardley Premium disks sink fast and are fairly small and come in excellent packaging that keeps any moisture out. Just about all of my fish go ga-ga for them too.
customer_reviews.author: Travelin5FamilyMan

customer_reviews.title: Always buy these online
customer_reviews.text: Fish food from the store has a huge markup from what I have found on amazon. Our fish are healthy and we have been able to find all the different types of food products they like for way cheaper. These algae tablets are much better then the thin green discs we have used before and the plecostomus seem to like them better.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Matz

customer_reviews.title: Different formula - inferior!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for many years, but this last order was different - the pellets broke apart when the fish started eating them and dirtied the tank. Unless this was a defective batch, the company must have changed the formula (cheaper for them) and given us an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kanter

customer_reviews.title: It sinks to the bottom very easily, even when broken down
customer_reviews.text: My bottom feeder loves this stuff. The pellets are small but too large for my single bottom feeder so I generally try to break one up into 2 pieces. I throw one in every day. It sinks to the bottom very easily, even when broken down. After a few hours it starts to expand a bit and is just sitting there waiting to be eaten. Mine likes to go after the pellets once he has done the bulk of his cleaning rounds for the day. I have never tried a product from Wardley before, so after this experience I would be interested to try others from them.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: My water became toxic with nitrite and nitrates aafter only 1 week. Fish waste increased 400 percent with poop all over the bottom. I lost an old fish. And these pellets stink.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Kienzle

customer_reviews.title: Good for a larger betta
customer_reviews.text: One of my bettas chocked on this food and died. It was just too large for him. Maybe if my fish had been an adult or larger size it wouldn’t have ended so tragically.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hall

customer_reviews.title: Try a new lid please
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars for flavor because my fish seems to keep eating it. Maybe one day he will tell me haha. But two stars because I need something with a screw on lid. This pluck open thing is silly considering there's 100000 mini pieces of fish food waiting to blast all over my kitchen floor.
customer_reviews.author: L&J

customer_reviews.title: Sinks quick, dissolves super fast
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a posting for one canister of pellets but we received 3 canisters and it’s a pretty big canister. My only complaint is that they dissolve super fast. They sink quick which is nice and our crawfish loves them but they dissolve super fast which has dirtied my tank up quickly
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Everybody loves them.
customer_reviews.text: My cats and fish love these. They're a little large for my fish but I pop them in the ninja and blast them to bits. The fry go crazy over them too. Even my picky little bumblebee gobies will eat them and they normally don't eat anything that's not wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: M Kriege

customer_reviews.title: You like moldy fish tanks?
customer_reviews.text: Every tank used this in got mold. Would highly recommend you stay away. It was the only thing that I used in my loach tank, my shrimp tank, and my snail tank. All three ended up with mold. I didn't even know tanks could get mold until I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product
customer_reviews.text: Super fast shipping huge bottle for price My shrimp babies love it one pellet expands a lot when you drop it in water so one pellet probably could feed like 10 or more so next time I am just going to crush it up so mine don’t over eat ( I have 2 dwarfs )
customer_reviews.author: Badass chick

customer_reviews.title: ALL MY FISH LOOOVVEE THIS FOOD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG Every Single One Of My Fish Absolutely Loves These Shrimp Pellets!! From The Top Swimmers To The Bottom Feeders.. All My Guppies, Tetras, Tiger Bars, Bettas, Cory's, Catfish Even My Ghost Shrimp lol They ALL LOVE These Pellets!!! & You Cant Beat The Price!!! Will Definitely Order Again!! Thanks & God Bless
customer_reviews.author: Kay Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great source of protein for SAE, my all fish food
customer_reviews.text: My angels, guppies, swordtails, corycats pleco and my SEA love it. They seem to bull rush and food as soon as it hits the water. The pellets are big enough that the angels don't try to eat it whole. Great source of protein for my SAE. Don't forget when SAEs get big the need protein. You don't want them munching on your other fish.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnHonestBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Kind Of Expensive!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only fish food my 6 Goldfish want to eat. They really love it & go crazy when they get it! They like it since it sinks to the bottom & it gives them something to dig through the rocks to find. It doesn't make the water cloudy either. I use to be able to buy this food in various places for $1.99 - $2.49 a container but now it cost a lot more & is more difficult to find. I dread the day the company ever stops making it.
customer_reviews.author: Carla 💘

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, (my) cories love them
customer_reviews.text: Quality: My cories love em (not that cories are super picky). As has been mention by other reviewers, does tend to expand/dissolve pretty fast, so don't throw in too many at a time (I'm personally okay with this, as it gives my cories time to eat them before the cichlids find them [yes I have acei cichlids and cories together and no they do not get attacked or even nipped at]). Cheaper (at time of purchase/review, under $4) than buying at my local Petco/Petsmart for this amount of food. Definitely will be buying again at these prices.
customer_reviews.author: Liviuslol

customer_reviews.title: 6.8 ounce can is HUGE
customer_reviews.text: LIke, 8 inches tall huge. I thought I ordered the size I already had (3 ounce) but I must have been I too much of a hurry to notice. We will have to buy more because it will be stale, not because they've eaten it all. lol One less thing to worry about during self isolation! ha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value!
customer_reviews.text: I've got that huge can on a promotion for slightly less than 3 bucks and I have to say this will last me at least a year! I'm keeping it in the fridge to try to preserve it better. I have 4 fish tanks with small to medium fish and I've been feeding them twice a day for almost two months now and I don't think I've used even 1/4 of the whole volume. My fish seems to get frenzy when they see those flakes. I like it a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Lev

customer_reviews.title: Fish isn't dead yet
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. I use these with an automatic fish feeder, and it seems to work ok. My fish has a tendency to gulp too much air at the surface of the tank, so flake food isn't a good option. These sink to the bottom of the tank, eliminating the problem. I do need to clean the gravel more often, as the pellets break apart and gunk things up faster than flake food.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not paying attention to the size, rather going by price, and at $2.50 I made the assumption that it would be the small can you get at the grocery stores. This is not that small can at all, this is the industrial sized vat of fish food and will probably last me for well over a year, so great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Bargain
customer_reviews.text: Great big drum full of fish flakes with all the same nutrients as the expensive brands at a great price. Our goldfish eat them just as voraciously as they did the expensive brands. You’re just throwing money away if you buy any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Racer

customer_reviews.title: Great quantity and quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It says you only need to use a teaspoon for ten gallons tank and I have only a one-gallon so it will last a while. I was worried that the water I was using for my fish would degrade its health but now that I bought this, I don't have to worry anymore.
customer_reviews.author: JESS

customer_reviews.title: Fish food - check
customer_reviews.text: The fish eat it. Nobody has thrown their fins in the air and started complaining. Nothing has died or gotten sickly. The water quality has remained high. I have Convicts and some African Cichlids in there, plus an aquatic turtle. This isn't the only food they are given, so your mileage may vary if you feed your fish this only this. Personally, I like to mix a flake and pelleted food. The turtle munches his food sticks and fresh fruits and veggies; the fish partake as well. I've kept a freshwater aquarium for 25 years, so I know a bad product when I come across one. This stuff is perfectly acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jens

customer_reviews.title: Pleco, snails & shrimp love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first of all the good reviews BUT bought this mainly for my pleco fish, my snails and shrimps really love it too. Definitely will last you a longg time. Received it a few months ago and I wanna say I only used up an ounce. The food will eventually turn into mush at the bottom of the tank, but doesn’t get soggy fast once you put the food in the water. Noticed that they all grew really fast once I started giving them these. Wardley is an excellent brand, even my 4 year old turtle got hooked to their green packaging, turtle pellets. Highly recommend these and the brand overall!
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Will get it again
customer_reviews.text: Very good my betta fish likes this the only problem that I have is that the lid does not close very well and if you try to put it somewhere or stored it in a covered or a drawer most unlikely the fish food with dropout but other than that it's good just that the lid falls off and it doesn't really fit
customer_reviews.author: Zelika

customer_reviews.title: Package design needs help
customer_reviews.text: So this needs to be redesigned or something because this is hard to open ..the top doesn’t screw on like most fish foods.. it pops on and off which can lead to fish food flying everywhere if you aren’t careful so be warned. Other than that this food is pretty good my betta likes it
customer_reviews.author: SouthernGentleman81

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a great price
customer_reviews.text: My koi and catfish love this food! I’m so disappointed that it’s no longer available. The price was great and shipping was fast. I hope they begin making this available again with a competitive price. Otherwise, I have to go back to Walmart. 😢
customer_reviews.author: Ms. T. Ching

customer_reviews.title: worked differently than expected but all is good
customer_reviews.text: Got this to feed my small koi since there was too much competition from the large fish. It worked but not in the way I expected. The large fish abandoned the floating food for the sinking food and the small fish went after the floating food.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Good food, floats
customer_reviews.text: I have three betta who love this. They've grown a lot since I started this food. My blue betta became a lot brighter as well. The food floats instead of sinking which my fish prefer. Container arrived smashed, but Amazon quickly replaced it for me with no hassle after contacting them.
customer_reviews.author: Hankley

customer_reviews.title: A ton of food!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I ordered the 1.95 oz one last time, but forgot, so I ordered the 6.8 instead. It will probably go bad before it's all used, but the fish seem to LOVE it. They go crazy every morning when I pick the can up. They all swim to the top of the tank, ready to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Cady Heron

customer_reviews.title: My fish love them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my two catfish, they love it! They had been hesitant to eat the pellets I was buying before, but they can't get enough of these! My cichlid will swoop in and steal them too, they're all he'll eat now. My crawfish will eat them too if he's lucky enough to find any leftover after the others eat. My fish are at a healthy weight and their color is better looking. One container of this lasts insanely long too, which is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Volpe

customer_reviews.title: Finally, food my betta will eat!
customer_reviews.text: I went through 3 different brands, flakes and pellets, and my betta would barely touch them. I thought he would starve to death. I decided to try Wardley pellets. They were much cheaper than everything else, so why not. I was pleasantly surprised to find him quickly go over and snap them all up quickly. He loves it, so five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Steggy

customer_reviews.title: I should have read more closely
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was food for shrimp. The main ingredient in this food IS SHRIMP 😂 Luckily shrimp don't mind eating shrimp. My shrimp, snails, convict cichlids & others LOVE this stuff. It sinks quickly, flakes apart easily, and is consumed completely. It's a winner for me!
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Like steroids for my bottom feeder
customer_reviews.text: My bristlenose loves this food. He grew from a half inch to 6+ inches in about 9 months. the other fish pick up whatever he is too slow to get to. I have this on "save and subscribe" every 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: B-Side

customer_reviews.title: A must for your fishes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for years!!! My dojo, zebra and yoyo loaches go crazy for this food!!! Along with my koi, upside down catfish, bichir and 3 plecos. The price for this food is really cheap for the amount you get! Doesn't cloud your water and everything that swims in your tank will love the food! :)
customer_reviews.author: aaron habig

customer_reviews.title: Like em!
customer_reviews.text: These are good and my cory catfish love them. Even my guppy dives down to gobble these up. They do dissolve quickly and can be messy until you figure out how many to drop in at one time. As soon as you figure out how many your fish will eat right away you won't have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great for my corys.
customer_reviews.text: Have a tank with lots of corys and these pellets are their primary food source. They're a good size and work reasonably well in my automatic feeder when its necessary. Update: As of Sept 2020 it seems the pellets have changed a little. They are now larger, more pellet-shaped, and sink a little faster. Not a huge deal but I would prefer the old style.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nerite snail. The problem I had with other algae wafers was that most of them were too big for 1 nerite snail. This one is just the right size for it. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Hyejin (Grace) Choi

customer_reviews.title: Fish love it.
customer_reviews.text: I was feeding my cichlids flakes for cichlids, along with pellets and other varied diet. I started feeding them this, along with the varied diet and they are doing so much better!!
customer_reviews.author: EllyM

customer_reviews.title: Out of sea monkey or sea dragon food? Use this!
customer_reviews.text: These tabs ground up will give you years and years worth of food for sea monkeys and sea dragons. The biggest problem most folks have is over feeding. If the water gets cloudy, don't feed again until it clears. When it's clear, just a pinch will do or use the tiny measuring spoon that came with your monkeys or dragons.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hipp

customer_reviews.title: for larger fish
customer_reviews.text: Fish like this stuff, but since pellets are rather large (comparatively speaking), be sure your fish can handle them. Example: my telescopes, and especially angel fish have difficulty eating these pellets, even though they try hard. Gold fish and bala sharks, on another hand, love it can easily swallow them. So now days I start with these pellets, so larger fish eats first, then add smaller pellets/flakes for smaller fish. This is the only reason for taking 1 star off, otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: g-man

customer_reviews.title: My fish love these.
customer_reviews.text: I have several types of fish, and all of my various bottom feeders especially love these. The pellets start to break apart almost as soon as they enter the water, but the fish devour them before that becomes a problem. (Don't overfeed, though.)
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and active fish
customer_reviews.text: My fish are fussy! I tried so many fish foods. They just leave them. I couldn’t believe that fish could act like that! Finally I tried this and they love it! My Koi catches it as it falls along with the gold fish.. they all seem satisfied and are thriving! I’m so happy with their active and heathy appearance!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Koi love it
customer_reviews.text: Was using Omega One but it is three times the cost. Ingredients are similar (not quite as good) and nutrition value still much better than many other fish foods out there. Fish show the same interest in this food.
customer_reviews.author: Sharpsteel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this food. Since feeding it to my fish, 5 have died. All in different tanks so I know it’s not the water. I’m so mad right now that I’ve lost some of my favorite fish that I’ve had for along time.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Cory's, guppys, and tetra love this food!
customer_reviews.text: All of my fish really love this food. It makes the water a little cloudy, but you can get around this by feeding less and more often. Overall very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H.

customer_reviews.title: He likes is
customer_reviews.text: My beta seems to be interested in mealtime with this food. He is alive and appears to be thriving so I guess the food is providing what he needs and I appreciate the delivery as I keep forgetting when I go to the store.
customer_reviews.author: wildpansyks

customer_reviews.title: Value and worth it
customer_reviews.text: First of all i dont know the flavor myself but my fish love it. It os affordable and is a very large container. I fond this to be the beat value for the buck. I only review my favorite or my most unfavorable.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome person

customer_reviews.title: Crab loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My crab dances when I put the food in the tank lol
customer_reviews.author: cindy mamabungu

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: We have a small tank with small fish. It looked like the size of the pellets were too big for our small fish. Seemed they had a difficult time getting the pellets in their mouths and the food made the tank water very foggy.
customer_reviews.author: Su

customer_reviews.title: Great food! Feeding frenzy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Cichlids went nuts over these pellets! Downside they sink fast and break down equally as fast but judt drip a few at a time and they will not even allow them to touch the ground. Pay close attention to the size as well. My cichlids are just barely able to manage them with each being about 3-5 inches. They can eat them but alot of food is broken down in the tank while they break it down. Still very manageable and they absolutely love them as a treat! Very good product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I didn't love it but the fish did
customer_reviews.text: Well, I didn't love it but the fish did. I've had a similar experience as the other four and five star reviewers. It doesn't dissolve and cloud up the water. I wanted something that would brighten the colors on an old clown loach and keep them bright on a new clown. I chose this based on customer reviews and because it makes this claim on the product page (although it doesn't say so on the label). After less than a week, they seem a little brighter and my husband thinks they are "perkier". I will edit after more time has passed.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie the Clean Queen

customer_reviews.title: All varieties of bottom feeders LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I have clown knife fish, redtail catfish & axolotl. They all LOVE these pellets, I think the flavor is their favorite. They eat these more than other shrimp pellets!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great food, but container doesn’t close well.
customer_reviews.text: Overall satisfied. Betta likes it. Came on time just as expected. The bottle however does not close tightly, when tipped over or dropped it opens easily. Not recommended for a family with children who love to feed the fish, unless you plan on moving the product to a new container.
customer_reviews.author: RN4baby

customer_reviews.title: The only Pellets that my goldfishes love!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this gold fish pellets from Hartz Wardley for last 14 years for my goldfishes. Some of my goldfishes lived for more than 9 years in my 55 gallon fish tank happily surviving eating these floating pellets. These do not make the water cloudy and my goldfishes love them. I used to purchase these from local supermarket but off lately the local supermarket stopped carrying them and when I saw these on Amazon I purchased a few containers to keep in stock knowing that I will never run out of them again. My goldfishes love them. Good Product. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Bhatta's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: My koi love this food!
customer_reviews.text: My koi seem to very much enjoy this food. It is just the right size and shape to fit into their mouths. It also works quite well in a food machine, allowing me to set the opening for consistent drop size. So, I always can be sure they are neither overeating or starving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a excellent price for the huge can . my corys love them. They dont cloud the water at all. They sink right to bottom. I trust this brand
customer_reviews.author: angelina

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Larger container than expected, but that makes it a great value for the price. I have guppies and they love it, but there's not much that they won't eat.
customer_reviews.author: Fiery_Dragoness

customer_reviews.title: Fish likes it a lot
customer_reviews.text: My betta really likes this stuff! I’m new to fish ownership, so it could be average or not, but I’ll give him one or two pellets, he’ll swim away, and then he’ll loop back to the feeding spot and circle around until I give a little more. THEN he’ll swim away, and he doesn’t ever spit it out. He also began eating sooner rather than later after being moved to the aquarium. So I recommend it! Go forth and feed your fishy!
customer_reviews.author: L.C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price but i wish the flakes would not be so little and crumble so easily. Ive used the tetra flakes before and they hold their shape and dont crumble as easily. Update. 2/16/16. So i have 1/4 left of the food and have to say the rest of the flakes are just crumbs. When i feed the fish it just sinks to the bottom... its like pouring sand. The food is very fine and just sinks to the bottom. Going back to Tetra flakes. Those hold their shape even when you get to the bottom of the can.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Not for shrimp.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I was told in the question and answer section by I think the seller that these are good for shrimp. My shrimp do not go near them at all, but as my large goldfish scoff them down the will not go to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Fish love them too!
customer_reviews.text: Have a pleco (Bottom feeder) and four Balla Sharks and the ballas love this stuff more than my bottom feeder lol it does make the water super cloudy but it does go away after a little while. AND it can make your water smell like a lake LOL but nothing to be alarmed about
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Mercer McCord

customer_reviews.title: It used to have great value.
customer_reviews.text: Wardley Shrimp Pellet Fish Food for Bottom and Algae Eaters - 9oz Sold by: Amazon.com Services, Inc Add-on Item $2.57 Condition: New Yes! It used to be $2.57. My fish loves them but i can not spend 13 dollars for an item used to be $2.57.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Seems mighty tasty to fish, they eat it as fast as they can!
customer_reviews.text: My fish really like this food. Whenever they see me they hurry and swim over to me to get fed. I recommend this fish food. Ut was well packaged and delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Stargate

customer_reviews.title: Fish love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for pygmy Cory's, but even my apistogramma who arr quite picky eaters enjoy it. Note they dont eat any other pellets. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Good flake food, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, not a premium flake, but a good value. ps: FOR ANY FISHFOOD, if your fish don't eat it all, it is because "you gave them too much". "Always feed the cheapest food first" (ie, cheap sinking pellets in morning, medium priced flakes in the afternoon, frozen or live food at nite, ETC)
customer_reviews.author: William B. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A fish favorite
customer_reviews.text: My little betta loves these! I give him 2 pellets twice a day and he seems to love them! They’re high in protein and fiber, and there’s tens of thousands of pellets in the container. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: em121212

customer_reviews.title: Too big for my betta fish
customer_reviews.text: My betta was used to smaller size pallets, these were comparatively huge in comparison. The betta would not eat them until I would crush them up. Made it really inconvenient to feed my fish. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: El Doc Thor

customer_reviews.title: A MUST!
customer_reviews.text: My cichlids LOVE these things!! My silver dollars like to nibble on them, my bristle nose pleco likes to suck in them, makes my fish very happy
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: Warning do not buy
customer_reviews.text: It makes your aquarium water cloudy and throws the balance off. Will never buy again. Yes it’s a value but it you care about your fish like I do you should not buy. I lost my green terror because of this food.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Mainer

customer_reviews.title: My aquatic turtle loves this
customer_reviews.text: I first got this food product at a petstore and w/in the past few mos, stopped supplying it. My serrated hinged side neck turtle Jean loves this food and likes to eat from the bottom of the aquarium. I am happy I can still get it. The 5 star is because of finding it available and that my Jean can have food she really likes. I do know, however, that not all turtles will love this food.My Pelusios Castanaeus side neck is an example. Both are 3 years old. The 2 turtles are both thought to be female.
customer_reviews.author: HO turtles

customer_reviews.title: Great fish food will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: I only have a few bottom feeders so quickly realize this container is going to last a very long time. Some snails like this food too.
customer_reviews.author: Phu Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: My cory catfish love the shrimp Pellets. Also bought the tropical flakes. Amazing quality and pricing on both items. Will definitely be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: My goldfish DONT even like it. That should tell you how bad it ...
customer_reviews.text: Id give it a zero if possible. This stuff crumbles as soon as it hits the bottom of the tank. My goldfish DONT even like it. That should tell you how bad it is. I bought it for Violet goby, and Birchir, but they never touched it. So i figured id use it as feed for my feeder goldfish. All it does is clog up the filter faster and provide nutrients for algae. Going back to Hikari . Yes a lot more expensive, but at least they make stuff fish will eat,
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: The food arrived quickly and within a day or two, the two betta fish’s colors were already more vibrant. They love the food and it really has restored both the delta betta and the bumblebee betta to brighter than when they were purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Love this fish food
customer_reviews.text: My fishes in the outdoor pond loves this fish food. They are healthy, most of them lives longer than 10 years and also keeps pond water clear.
customer_reviews.author: KK

product_meta.title: Wardley Fish Food and Accessories
product_meta.description: Size:16.75 oz| Style:Cichlid PelletsWardley Premium Medium Floating Goldfish Pellets provide the ideal balance of nutrients your goldfish require to support normal growth. Also contains a stabilized form of Vitamin C to support a healthy immune system. This formula maximizes protein utilization and reduces fish waste to help maintain clearer water and a healthy environment for your fish.
feature_bullets: Fish food designed to provide the ideal balance of nutrients your goldfish require to support normal growth
Includes 16.75 ounces of medium floating pellets in a convenient, easy-to-store jar
Fortified with a stabilized form of vitamin C that promotes a healthy immune system in fish
Contains no added artificial dyes that can harm fish or cloud water
Maximizes protein utilization and reduces fish waste to help maintain clearer water and a healthy environment for your fish

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
